measured_by: Child Behavior Checklist – Attention Problems subscale
justification: “Attention problems were measured using the attention problems subscale from the Child Behavior Checklist (CBCL, age 6-18 form).”
“…we also performed the analyses with the ADHD subscale which resulted in comparable results.”

measured_by: Drift Diffusion Model drift-rate (v) parameter estimated with HDDM from Stop-Signal Task
justification: “We used the Hierarchical Drift-Diffusion Modelling (HDDM) package… to estimate … drift rate for each participant” and “drift rate reflects the rate of evidence accumulation.”

measured_by: Drift Diffusion Model decision-threshold (a) parameter estimated with HDDM from Stop-Signal Task
justification: “Decision threshold describes response caution or the speed-accuracy trade-off… we estimated … decision threshold for each participant.”

measured_by: Drift Diffusion Model non-decision time (t) parameter estimated with HDDM from Stop-Signal Task
justification: “Non-decision time describes perceptual processes like stimulus encoding and motor response… we estimated non-decision time for each participant.”
